metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8858 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The uglify-js package before 2.6.0 for Node.js allows attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input in a parse call, aka a "regular expression denial of service (ReDoS)."

criterions.comment: uglifyjs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
